listing.description: Key features:- 4 bedroom cottage- Rich History- Stable Block- Annex- Stunning grounds with pond- Abundance of character featuresFull description:A stunning 4 bedroom detached cottage situated within tranquil, picturesque surroundings on the outskirts of Bricket Wood. With a rich history dating back to before 1900, The Old Fox With His Teeth Drawn used to be a temperance pub, serving tea until approximately 1930 when it was transformed into a place of residence - it has even been the feature of its own postcard around the time of wwi! With countless characterful features, this thatched roof abode briefly comprises: Large traditional kitchen, utility room, living room, formal reception room with adjoining dining room, family room, master bedroom with en-suite and dressing area, 4 further bedrooms, family bathroom and additional shower room. Externally, the property features its own pond and tendered, mature grounds. There is a stable block on the grounds in addition to a stand alone garage and studio.

listing.short_description:
Guide price £1,000,000 - £1,200,000 This substantial house (with 2235 Sq Ft or 207 Sq Metres) is situated on a prestigious road in Mottingham overlooking Mottingham Sports Ground/Foxes Field's. The property is situated within a few minutes walk from a range of amenities including Mottingham Village, a variety of distinguished schools, 0.2mi to highly regarded Eltham College and 0.6mi to Mottingham Train Station. With charming aesthetics, the front garden is mainly laid to lawn, with shrubs and trees to keep in line with the road itself. The generously sized Entrance Hall sets the standard accommodation you can expect throughout. The l-shaped Lounge has plenty of living accommodation and a bay window overlooking the fields across the road, a log burner adds to the warming homely feel. The Dining Room is located off the lounge and leads to the Conservatory which is equipped for winter with central heating radiators and makes a great space for peaceful living overlooking the garden. The Kitchen/Breakfast Room has a range of integrated appliances to suit all your needs. The Utility Room has wall and base units, plumbing for a washing machine and a butler-style double sink. Finally, no large home is complete without the essential Ground Floor WC and an additional reception for the children. The first floor accommodation comprises a spacious Landing with storage and loft access, Four Double Bedrooms (Master Bedroom with 4-piece En-Suite) and a 4-piece Family Bathroom. Externally to the rear, this home boasts a pleasant Rear Garden which is mainly laid to lawn, with shrub borders, a shed and large patio area. Additional benefits to note include double glazing, gas central heating, a Double Garage with twin up and over doors, power & light and it's own loft, and Off Road Parking to the front for several vehicles. Virtual Reality Tour Available Properties such as this are rarely available so Call Us today To Arrange Your Viewing!

Mottingham is a town set in the London Borough of Bromley with great transport links whether from the A20, the South Circular or via Mottingham Mainline Station. This is a very popular spot as you can get to London Bridge within 20 minutes. A few key landmarks are scattered around the town, so if you have a keen eye for pretty sights it's worth a day exploring the town. As living in Mottingham goes, there isn’t many it can’t cater for - its High Street with international retailers, a few large supermarkets and a number of highly recommended restaurants and bars. As a whole the Bromley Borough has an array of wonderful schools, whether the family need primary or secondary education with many showing outstanding ‘Ofsted’ reports.

listing.description: Savoy Realty is pleased to offer this fantastic 1 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment for sale in Westminster Quarter development on the 3rd floor.About DevelopmentThe design and construction of one 7/8-storey building, and one 5-storey building, to provide a total of 102 residential units above a 340m2 commercial floor space at ground floor level on Monck Street. Associated basement to provide 56 dedicated car parking spaces and 204 cycle parking and mechanical plant space. The apartments are designed to achieve ‘Lifetimes Homes Standards’ and ‘Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4’.The development will comprise 102 private luxury apartments, many with private outdoor space. Residents will also benefit from an exclusive gym, 24hr concierge service and landscaped courtyard. A landscaped residents’ roof terrace and roof lounge which will afford unrivalled views of the Houses of Parliament and other iconic landmarks. Stylish interiors designed to the highest specification invite residents to relax and feel instantly at home. From bespoke kitchens and luxury appliances, every detail has been observed. Many of the stunning apartments benefit from winter gardens or balconies. Floor to ceiling windows help flood the living areas with natural light and give the feeling of space.The interior designed lobby will also provide a waiting area for guests and is also where your post box will be kept. The ground floor features an exclusive gym for residents of Westminster Quarter. It features large windows, which will look out onto the picturesque courtyard to create a bright and airy workout space. The roof of Chadwick House will feature a unique private landscaped terrace offering stunning views across the London skyline.

The site is approx 3.9 acres and genty rises from the road and has good visibility and is regular in shape as the plan suggestsIn the more immediate loctaion is Hendra Holiday Park on the opposite side of the road and mainly agricultural land abutting the site. Newquay resort centre and beaches is 2.5 miles approx away and the A30 main Cornwall trunk road is just 6.2 miles to the East. listing.description: Middleton Estates are proud to offer this impressive and substantial detached house. Located on one of Shoreham's premier tree lined roads, within walking distance of Shoreham Railway Station, town centre and popular local schooling. Set over two floors, this imposing period house has been updated throughout and now offers a modern, well proportioned family home. The ground floor is arranged offering large entrance hall, ground floor cloakroom, formal lounge with parquet flooring and feature open fire. The rear of the ground floor has been remodelled and now boasts 30' kitchen / diner / family room with feature contemporary solid fuel burner. The kitchen is finished to a high specification with integral appliances, corian work surfaces and feature preparation island. This south facing open plan living space benefits from bi-folding doors opening onto the rear patio. The third reception room / 5th bedroom also has access to recessed basement / office. Upstairs the four double bedrooms run from the beautiful gallery landing as well as family bathroom. The Master Suite includes dressing room and modern contemporary shower room. Outside the south facing rear garden is separated into 3 areas, the primary garden space is a paved patio with access to brick built studio with double glazing and vaulted ceiling. The secondary garden is laid to lawn with inset heated swimming pool and decked surround. listing.description: Description   This fabulous detached family home, situated at the end of a sweeping pathway, was built in 1938 for Miss Doris Harrison, daughter of a local millionaire, and is where she resided with her nurse. It was because of this fact that the house is unusual due to a second staircase leading to servants' quarters on the top floor. It has been said that 'Miss Harrison had the bricks for the house handmade and the pointing was an art itself'. In later years the property was bought by Dame Catherine Cookson and her husband Tom, and during their 22 year occupation Catherine spent her days writing in her study and transforming the house and gardens before leaving in 1976.Now the property has been recently refurbished and lovingly restored to echo the splendour of days gone by with a wealth of attractive features and generous accommodation including spacious rooms with high ceilings, plaster cornice and mouldings, handsome fireplaces have become focal points once more, polished wooden flooring and a stunning oak staircase to the first floor.On the ground floor the large reception hall opens into the grand reception rooms, as well as a formal dining room. The large kitchen/breakfast room has ample space for even a professional chef, as well as a boiler room, utility room and larder.The second floor landing is almost a room in itself and it is rumoured that Dame Catherine once housed a grand piano there. There are impressive master and guest rooms with modern en-suites, two further bedrooms as well as a family bathroom and additional shower room. The inner hall gives access to the second staircase to the uppermost floor, where there are two further bedrooms and walk-in loft storage.Outside, the gardens have been reinstated and mature trees and shrubs planted, as well as specimen plants uncovered and brought back to life. The wide terrace to the rear has been carefully renovated and re-laid with original materials and now gives a palatial feel with steps down to the lawn. The front garden has the long sweeping pathway with a tree-lined perimeter and a wealth of additional planting. For parking there is a double garage and space for numerous vehicles in front.The location of this wonderful home is one of the most prestigious in all of Hastings and is next to the picturesque St Helen's Woods, close to recreational and sporting facilities and yet a short walk from the town centre for shopping, mainline train station to London and the Old Town.Porch  Covered external porch. Leading to part glazed wooden front door.Entrance lobby  Fully enclosed with windows to the front and feature door to the hall. Original tiled floor, burglar alarm control panel, door to cloakroom.Cloakroom  Double glazed window to the front, original style suite with wash basin and wc, plus original 1930's style tiling. Tiled flooring.Reception hall  Grand entrance hall with sweeping oak staircase rising to the first floor. Under stairs cupboard. Radiators with feature covers. Polished wooden flooring. Ornate cornice ceiling. Wall lighting. Double glazed door to the rear garden. Door to the inner hallway.Dining room  Double glazed windows to the front and side. Cornice ceiling with ornate ceiling rose. Feature fireplace and grate. Wooden flooring.Sitting room  Double glazed windows to the rear and side. Feature fireplace with open fire grate and tiled hearth. Cornice ceiling with feature ceiling rose. Wooden flooring.Drawing room  Double glazed windows to the rear and both sides. Feature fire surround from France. Cornice ceiling with feature ceiling roses. Wooden flooring.Larder  Walk in larder style cupboard with a double glazed window to the side. Shelving.Inner hallway  Secondary staircase leading to the two floors above. Wooden flooring. Door to kitchen.Kitchen/breakfast room  Double glazed windows to both front and rear. Twin inset Belfast style sink with mixer taps set into an island unit with granite work surface. Matching range of cupboards and drawer units with granite work surface and upstand. Integrated dishwasher, fridge/freezer and cooker hood. Range style cooker set in recess with five ring gas hob, double oven and grill. Inset ceiling spotlights.Boiler room  Walk in room with double glazed window to the side. Gas boiler for heating to the ground floor and hot water. Two hot water cylinders.Utility room  Double glazed window to the side. Stainless steel sink unit. Base unit with granite work surface and upstand. Plumbing and space for a washing machine and separate dryer. Part glazed door to the front. Door to 2nd boiler room.Boiler room 2  Wall mounted boiler for the first and second floor heating systems.Galleried landing  Double glazed window to the rear. Cornice ceiling. Wooden flooring. Wall lights.Bathroom  Double glazed window to the front. White bathroom suite comprising of panelled bath with mixer tap, fitted shower screen, twin wash hand basins set into a tiled surround and with cupboards under, low level wc, tiled walls and flooring, heated towel rail and shaver point.Master bedroom  Double glazed windows to the side and rear. Built in wardrobes with sliding doors. Cornice ceiling. Wooden flooring. Door to en-suite.Ensuite shower room  Double glazed window to the side. Tiled shower cubicle, pedestal wash basin, wc, heated towel rail, inset spot lights, shaver point, tiled walls and flooring.Guest bedroom  Double glazed windows to front, side and rear. Built in wardrobes with sliding doors. Cornice ceiling. Carpeted. Door to ensuite.Ensuite bathroom  Double glazed window to the front. White suite comprising panelled bath with mixer tap and shower screen, pedestal wash basin, wc, shaver point and carpeted.Bedroom 3  Double glazed window to the front and side. Built in wardrobe with sliding door. Feature fire surround. Cornice ceiling. Wooden flooring.Bedroom 4  Double glazed window to rear and side. Built in wardrobe with sliding doors. Cornice ceiling. Wooden flooring. Currently used as a study.Inner hall  Staircase to upper and lower floors. Wooden flooring. Door to shower room.Shower room  Double glazed window to the side. Tiled shower cubicle, wash hand basin, wc, inset spot lights and tiled walls and flooring.Landing  Second floor landing with feature port hole style window to the side. Wooden flooring. Door to the walk in loft storage.Bedroom 5  Double glazed recessed window. Built in corner cupboard. Wooden flooring.Bedroom 6  Double glazed window to the front. Wooden flooring.Rear garden  Re-laid raised terrace with steps down to a further patio area and steps down to the lawned garden. Variety of mature trees and shrubs, flowerbeds, exterior lighting and access to the under house store area. The gardens contain many of the specimen plants and trees that were planted during Dame Catherine's ownership and have been added to by the current owners.Front garden  Fenced perimeter and decorative wrought iron gate leads beautifully into the landscaped garden. Established flowerbeds, mature trees and shrubs line the sweeping pathway to the house, with a seating area located at the top of the pathway. Pond. Access to both sides of the house.Parking  Block paved driveway provides off road parking for multiple vehicles and leads to the garage.Double garage  With electric up and over doors to match the house, power and light.

listing.description: This unique, beautiful and elegant dwelling is situated in the heart of the Calderstones Area located on the fringe of the prestigious Calderstones Park set behind a sandstone wall and deep secluded front garden. The property is beautiful in design and will offer any prospective purchaser with an enviable lifestyle. The elegant sweeping roof lines and external lateral stacks are typical of the period in which it was constructed and the property presents Liverpool's marketplace with arguably one of the most rare opportunities in recent yearsThe accommodation is bright, inviting and set out over two floors.In addition to the principal accommodation, there is a family games room situated above the garage which provides an alternative bedroom suite and offers potential for further extension and improvement subject to obtaining the necessary planning permission and building control consents.The leisure complex which includes a swimming pool, changing room, shower room and a sauna provide that extra element of charm and sophistication to this truly wonderful property.Approached via a deep frontage, the property is accessed via an entrance porch which leads into a wonderful and inviting reception hall with the focal point being a return staircase to the first floor with decorative cast iron frets to compliment. There is a drawing room which is generously proportioned connecting to a family room and bar area in addition to a formal dining room.A ground floor WC, cloak room, family dining kitchen are also accessible from the reception hall. A rear hall provides access to the utility room, further WC, garage and leisure complex.The leisure complex is bright, spacious and cleverly designed with a beautiful swimming pool, sauna, shower area and changing room. A staircase leads to the guest suite above the garage which has a number of uses including an alternative bedroom of family games room.To the first floor of the main dwelling there is a landing, master suite with dressing area and en suite as well as three bedrooms, a bathroom and separate WC.This unique, beautiful and elegant dwelling is situated in the heart of the Calderstones Area located on the fringe of the prestigious Calderstones Park set behind a sandstone wall and deep secluded front garden. listing.description: This architecturally striking residence is delightfully located on the rural fringes of the village of Bapchild, which itself is conveniently close to the popular town of Sittingbourne - which now offers high speed rails services to the capital.The property itself offers sumptuous period character throughout and is currently configured with six bedrooms and three reception rooms. A large kitchen is complimented by a southerly facing garden room and the practicality of large cellarage.The property is attached on its western side to a small cottage that if additionally acquired could return a solid investment yield or be used as originally intended as an annexe to the main house. The cottage is tenanted but could be purchased via separate negotiation.The main property sits within wonderful grounds of fine lawns with established borders and mature trees. listing.description: Part exchange considered Wow.......An Elegantly Extended Detached House In The Heart Of Worsley! Occupying a commanding position on Sefton Drive. A simply outstanding detached family home which offers an abundance of space and luxurious living. This is a prestigious property with an understated elegance and the warmth and a welcoming feel of a real family home. The property leads you into an elegant entrance hall, through to a sumptuous lounge and sitting room, a fantastic state of the art dining kitchen, substantial dining/cinema room and at the heart of this home is a fabulous family room with outstanding views over the garden. A superb gymnasium and sauna for two. A study, ground floor cloakroom and utility room complete the ground floor. On the first floor are four very spacious and stylish bedrooms, three with impressive en-suite bathrooms, a laundry room offers the option of a 6th bedroom or small nursery. On the second floor a lavish double bedroom and full size en-suite bathroom .To the rear of the property is what can only be described as a 'glamorous' garden with a lavish decked terrace, patio and sun deck, a superb lawn leading to the bottom of the garden and out into Worsley woods if you choose.  Set in a substantial plot where the grounds are incredibly private. If you love entertaining or just having family gatherings at your house, this property has the open areas you need to pull off a great party. Located just off Worsley Road very close to 'The Green and Worsley Village and the beautiful Bridgewater Canal. From here you can simply walk into the village and along the canal. This is a very sought after location, close to Worsley woods so there are some stunning local walks, superb local restaurants and local bars. The property is well positioned for access to the M60, M61 Trafford Centre and Manchester Airport.Entrance Hall - 19' 1'' x 9' 11'' (5.81m x 3.02m)You enter this property into an elegant and spacious reception hallway, this stunning hallway is bright and airy, it has a modern finish but with a period twist. An impressive staircase leads to the first floor with a spindle banister and leads to a 'Mezzanine' style landing, the hallway is finished with a beautiful 'Travertine' style marble tiled floor, a period feature door and side window lead through to garden room, stylish light fittings, storage cupboard and cornice to the ceiling.Lounge - 19' 1'' x 13' 11'' (5.81m x 4.24m)A stylish and spacious lounge with a Upvc double glazed window to the front, traditional coal effect living flame gas fire set in a limestone inset, hearth and fire surround, solid wood doors lead through to the sitting room, stripped and stained flooring, two radiators and coving to the ceiling.Sitting Room - 13' 11'' x 11' 11'' (4.24m x 3.63m)A beautiful sitting room with gorgeous views over the rear garden, built in traditional style shelving and storage to one elevation, stripped and stained floors, a large Upvc double glazed window makes the most of the view and makes this a lovely light room, solid wood double doors lead through to the family room.Family Room - 20' 5'' x 11' 11'' (6.22m x 3.63m)A fabulous family room which just floods with natural light, superb Bi-Folding doors pull back to really bring the outside in and make the most of the views over the gorgeous garden, three double glazed Velux skylights simply add to the light, benefiting from under floor heating, this room is partially open to the kitchen and solid wood double doors lead to the dining room. It is this area of the house where you get a real sense of the fantastic entertaining space this property offers, boasting a real flexibility with the space which can opened up fully for entertaining or closed up to create private reception areas...The choice is yours!Dining Room - 15' 5'' x 11' 11'' (4.70m x 3.63m)A substantial dining room which again is perfect for dinner parties or sporting events with space for a large cinema screen, a Upvc double glazed window to the rear, walnut effect flooring, built in ceiling speakers, part open plan to the kitchen diner, radiator.Kitchen Diner - 20' 9'' x 11' 5'' (6.32m x 3.48m)A simply stunning dining kitchen which really is at the heart of this home, part open to a beautiful dining room and gorgeous family room offering a superb open plan family area. Presenting a contemporary, minimalistic Earl & Ginger kitchen, using dark lavish hi-gloss and atmospheric lighting this is a very glamorous kitchen. Featuring a comprehensive range of high gloss black wall and base units, a brightly lit 'Hot Pink' breakfast pantry, L shaped centre island with built in wine chiller, large pan drawers, five ring Siemens' gas hob with a Prestige extractor by 'Falmec', carved sink with a 'Quooker' instant hot water tap and contemporary mixer taps, extended work top creates are bar area with space for stools and three drop down 'Tom Dixon' lights, two Siemens built in electric ovens, glassware unit, large 'Siemens' fridge freezer, black high gloss granite tiled floor and recessed spot lighting.Utility Room - 10' 2'' x 7' 10'' (3.10m x 2.39m)A great room just off the kitchen with ample space for washing machine and dishwasher, granite effect work tops, sink and drainer, black granite hi- gloss floor and a door to the rear, large cupboard houses the Vallient boiler and an unvented cylinder.Downstairs WCAn elegant cloakroom incorporating low level WC with a concealed flush, contemporary hand basin with mixer tap, black granite tiled floor and mirror.Gym - 20' 7'' x 9' 10'' (6.27m x 2.99m)A fantastic home gymnasium with separate wood boarded sauna, wall mounted mirror, space for a large selection of gym equipment. A Upvc double glazed window to the front and rear staircase leads to the first floor with spindle banister, wood effect floor.Study - 15' 0'' x 11' 7'' (4.57m x 3.53m)A superb home office or additional reception room with a Upvc double glazed window to the front, traditional living flame gas fire set in a stone tiled inset and hearth, radiator and spotlights.First Floor LandingA light and airy landing with in a feature 'Mezzanine' style with spindle banister. A Upvc double glazed window to the front aspect and doors to all first floor bedrooms, ceiling coving.Master Bedroom & Ensuite - 19' 0'' x 11' 9'' (5.79m x 3.58m)A lavish master bedroom with elegant mirror fronted wardrobes, a fabulous floor to ceiling shoe cupboard which only a girl would truly appreciate! Finished with a solid oak floor, Upvc double glazed window to the front and radiator.En-Suite 13'11 x 12'0A luxurious and ample master bathroom suite, fitted with a five piece bathroom suite comprising of a low level W.C with concealed flush, his and hers wall mounted hand basins with large vanity mirror, large free standing curved bath with contemporary mixer tap, large tiled 'walk in' wet room shower with shower head, thermostatic valve and stool, under floor heating, slate effect tiling to two elevations and four Upvc double glazed windows to the rear elevation let in lots of natural light......Simply stunning!Bedroom With En-Suite - 12' 7'' x 11' 7'' (3.83m x 3.53m)A stylish double bedroom with a Upvc double glazed window to the rear, his and hers double wardrobes offer ample hanging and shelving, walnut wood effect floor, coving and radiator.En-Suite 6'11 x 5'7An attractive en-suite incorporating a bath with traditional style shower head and mixer tap, hand basin and low level WC, white wall and floor tiling, extractor.Bedroom - 12' 9'' x 8' 3'' (3.88m x 2.51m)A well presented double room with a Upvc double glazed window to the front, built in wardrobes and radiator.Bedroom & En-Suite - 18' 0'' x 12' 11'' (5.48m x 3.93m)A large double bedroom with a Upvc double glazed window to the front, spotlights and radiator.En-Suite 10'2 x 9'8A large en-suite bathroom incorporating a low level WC bath and hand basin both with mixer taps, shower enclosure, shower head and slider rail. Ceramic tiled floor and walls, radiator.Laundry Room - 10' 1'' x 8' 3'' (3.07m x 2.51m)The laundry room could have many uses depending on preference, with a Upvc double glazed window to the rear, built in wardrobes offering hanging and shelving, radiator.Second Floor LandingWith a Upvc double glazed window to the front, staircase and spindle banister, a door to the double bedroom and a door to the en-suite.Second Floor Bedroom - 19' 3'' x 9' 3'' (5.86m x 2.82m)A fantastic double bedroom with Upvc double glazed French door which open to a Juliet balcony and the most magnificent views of the rear garden and beyond, large walk in dressing area with a Velux skylight to the front. Radiator and spotlights.Second Floor En-Suite - 13' 11'' x 11' 0'' (4.24m x 3.35m)An impressive en-suite incorporating a his & hers 'Heritage' hand basins with storage under, simply huge walk in double wet room shower with mosaic tiling, 'Travertine' style ceramic tiled floor, low level WC, heated towel rail and spotlights.OutsideWith a commanding position on Sefton Road in Worsley, set in substantial plot with a superb 'in & out block paved driveway to the front, mature plants and shrubs to the borders and side gate for access. It is the rear garden which truly sets this property aside, a fabulous extension of the interior with the most superb decked terrace with ample space for garden furniture, a perfect place for relaxing outside with friends, a separate patio finished in Indian stone is ideal for outside dining, a fantastic lawn and pathway leads you down to sun deck at the bottom of the garden with an elegant water feature and an amazing view looking back up at this outstanding property. This a very private garden, with Worsley woods beyond. Property has solar panels to part of the roof.LocalityLocated just off Worsley Road very close to 'The Green and Worsley Village and the beautiful Bridgewater Canal. From her you can simply walk into the village and along the canal. This is a very sought after location, close to Worsley woods so there are some stunning local walks, superb local restaurants and local bars. The property is well positioned for access to the M60, M61 Trafford Centre and Manchester Airport.Additional InformationThe vendors have advised us that the property is FreeholdCouncil Tax band GSolar Panels to part of the roof

listing.description: A beautifully presented semi-detached family home in a fabulous tree lined crescent much respected locally as one of Whetstones most desired roads. There is good access to the transport network with Oakleigh Park overground and Totteridge and Whetstone underground stations both within easy reach. There is a good selection of shops, restaurants and eateries close by. The tastefully presented accommodation briefly comprises of a spacious entrance hall, dual aspect study, dining room with a wide bay to the front, a fabulous main reception room with views over the rear garden. The kitchen/breakfast room is a lovely family hub with extensive units, integrated appliances and space for a breakfast table. There is a generous size full laundry/utility room and a separate guest toilet. To the first floor are four bedrooms, with the master having views over the rear garden whilst also benefitting from an en suite bathroom. There is a further bathroom and a separate WC. The accommodation could be further extended by converting the attic space subject to planning permission. Externally the property has driveway parking to the front providing parking for several vehicles. The rear garden has a south/westerly aspect, well-manicured lawns with flower and shrub borders, pond and water feature.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: A detached family residence totalling approximately 2000 sq. Ft. Believed to be offered to the market for the first time and with significant scope for development or modernisation subject to the relevant consents. The current configuration comprises a 23 ft. Sitting room, kitchen/dining room with a conservatory and sun room overlooking the rear garden. There is a ground floor bedroom suite that could serve as a self contained annexe. To the first floor are three bedrooms and the family bathroom. All viewings are to be made via appointment with Hamptons International Winchester on .SituationThe property is located in a prime position in the village of Littleton. The rear garden backs onto a conservation area comprising woodland and open fields leading down to a bowling green, cricket pitch and pavilion and Littleton Tennis Club, which boasts six excellent hard courts, two of which are floodlit. The village benefits from a church, village hall and the popular Running Horse public house. The cathedral City of Winchester (approx. 2 miles) offers extensive cultural, educational and leisure facilities, alongside a wide range of shopping amenities and main line railway station linking to London Waterloo (about 1 hour). The A34 provides links to the Midlands and the North, with Junction 9 of the M3 (approx. 3 miles) giving access to London and the south coast.OutsideThe driveway to the front of the house provides ample parking for several vehicles. The garden, an outstanding feature of the property, lies to the side and the rear of the house. In all, the plot totals over 0.66 acre.Additional InformationServices: TbcLocal Authority: Winchester City Council

listing.description: Berkeleys - Delightful detached character cottage - Completely refurbished in recent years - Level south-westerly plot - Desirable Branksome Park location - 3 Double bedrooms - Dressing room and en-suite to master - Family bathroom - Living room with study area - Kitchen/breakfast room - Handmade French kitchen - Double garage - Summerhouse and garden storeThe Property    Twelve Trees Cottage is a delightful character property which has undergone complete refurbishment in recent years by the current owners and occupies a level south-westerly facing plot in one of Branksome Park's most desirable locations. The original house, we believe, was built over 200 years ago and is a house of local interest. The cottage has been sympathetically modernised throughout using materials, where possible, from the original house and garden. It retains many character features including open fireplaces and combines traditional architecture with modern living. The accommodation extends to approximately 1790 .The Location    Dover Road is a leafy un-adopted road set in the heart of Branksome Park and enjoys easy level access to local shops at Westbourne which are approximately quarter of a mile away. The beach, for which the area is renowned, is within one mile and a similar distance away is Parkstone 18-hole championship golf course. Poole Harbour is approximately 2 miles away with its numerous yacht clubs and marinas.The Accommodation    3 Double bedrooms - Dressing room to master - En-suite bathroom with Juliet balcony - Two further bedrooms - Family bathroom - Good sized living room with study area and locally handmade and designed open fireplace - Stunning kitchen/breakfast room with dining and seating area and open fireplace - Handmade French kitchen imported from France and fitted by French craftsmen with limestone flooring and Moroccan marble worktops - Southerly facing garden - Double garage with power and light - Summerhouse and garden store both with power and light - Driveway with off-road parking for several cars - 0.24 acre plot - Maintenance charges are approximately £200 per annum payable to the Dover Road Preservation Society who are responsible for the upkeep of the road and lighting - Council tax band G

listing.description: The HouseThe Farmhouse is timber framed with a tiled slate roof, with the original building thought to date back to the 15th Century with later additions. The main house offers a generous 3815 square feet of versatile living accommodation which has served our client?S family very well over the past 30 years.The large front porch area leads to the sitting room featuring a beautiful open fireplace with wood-burning stove and brick surround. To the left of the living room is a small library area which leads into another reception room, currently used as a dining room with office. The right of the living room leads to a useful boot-room with WC and separate laundry/airing room, which then leads through to the kitchen.The kitchen is a good size and is fitted around a central island and family table and chairs. There is a range of wooden wall and base units, an electric oven and hob, and space for a fridge freezer. Off the kitchen is a large rear porch leading out to the garden, a useful space for coats and shoes. Finally, through the left of the kitchen is a third reception room, currently used as a second reception room/drawing room.There are two staircases on the ground floor, the stairs to the left-hand side of the house lead to the master suite which has immediate access to a bath and shower room. The other staircase leads up to three further bedrooms which all share the use of a shower room. The second floor has two further rooms (currently set up as a living room and bedroom) with access to a bathroom.The HistoryThe Farmhouse is thought to have been home to Thomas Mills, an historic businessman known locally for his help to the poor and huge contributions towards the education of the town and surrounding area. Schools were opened in his name from 1751 through to the Thomas Mills High School of today.The GroundsThe house lies within 4.8 acres, which include a large area of lawn to the front of the house, a shingle in-and-out drive, woodland, two ponds, a three-bay cart-lodge, former pigsties (used for storage) and a number of paddocks which provide equestrian potential or income from letting.The ClinicThe clinic is a converted barn to the rear of the house which is currently set up as a physiotherapy and hydrotherapy rehabilitation centre, complete with a heated indoor pool, shower facilities, changing rooms, waiting area / reception and treatment room. Another part of the barn is used for storage and the first floor has been converted. This extremely versatile building is currently let at £6,000 per annum but has the potential for several other uses if required.The CottageThis charming renovated cottage is self-contained and whilst currently empty, it could be let out to provide an annual income of around £6,000 per annum, alternatively it would make an ideal annexe. The accommodation includes a living room, kitchen/dining room, bathroom and double bedroom, as-well-as a small conservatory. The cottage also has its own garden area which could be fenced off from the rest of the land, adding to its rental appeal.LocationThe property sits in a screened location in the heart of the peaceful village of Pettistree in Suffolk. The village has a thriving public house () and is only a short drive from Wickham Market which includes most necessary day-to-day amenities. The thriving and extremely popular market town of Woodbridge is just a few miles away.For commuters, Suffolk?S County town of Ipswich is accessible via the A12 and provides direct trains to London Liverpool Street with a journey time of just over an hour.Points to noteThe property is on mains drainage and electricity; the house has night storage heaters with an economy7 supply.The property may fall under ?Mixed use? Estate and thus the stamp duty is lower. The house is Grade two listed.Before booking a viewing of any Bloomfield Grey instruction, we suggest that buyers view its full online details including the street-view representation, the site map, the satellite view and the floor plan. If you have any questions, then please contact Bloomfield Grey.

listing.description: Key features:Strawberry cottageBuilt circa 1750A unique piece of history Double frontedDetachedFour bedroomsThree reception roomsTwo bathroomsGarageFront and rear gardensFull description:A wonderfully unique and incredibly distinguished double fronted family home.This property was built approximately 270 years ago during the reign of George II and its history is apparent in every brick.The property is detached and set back on manicured lawns, the plot on which it sits is spacious and the internal accommodation is symmetrical, well arranged and generously proportioned.The ground floor comprises a central staircase with two large reception rooms either side, there is a kitchen stretching the full width of the house and a drawing room to the rear, beyond this is a ground floor bathroom, access to the garage and a utility space.Upstairs is currently utilised as a holiday let, and provides hugely adaptable accommodation, there are four double rooms of equal size and a family bathroom.As well as the landscaped gardens to the front there is a spacious courtyard of fruit trees to the rear and a useable garage.This house is simply very special, its history and character are unparalleled locally and yet its adaptability and convenience is also ideal for modern living.Located just off the London Road, this home is moments from Isleworth mainline train station, a short walk from the village and close to the Duke of Northumberland's beautiful estate at Syon Park, as well as the historical riverside in Old IsleworthEPC Rating EBedroomBedroomBedroomBedroomBathroomBathroomReceptionReceptionReception

listing.description: Lovering House is an exceptional detached family property, set in large grounds of approximately 2/3 acre with private gated access. Having recently undergone a significant and comprehensive refurbishment this superb property now provides contemporary, luxurious accommodation set over four floors. The whole of the ground and lower ground floors are in Spanish Porcelain plank tiles with zoned, thermostatically controlled underfloor heating, whilst the first and second levels have golden oak flooring throughout. Rising from the spacious entrance hall is a bespoke golden oak staircase with led lighting and a steel and glass balustrade which connects the floors and leads to the spacious bedrooms and beautifully appointed bathrooms found on the upper floors.The main living area is an expansive open plan space combining Kitchen, Dining Room and Lounge with double bi-fold doors opening on to the pale grey Millboard decked area which stretches across the rear of the property. The kitchen is beautifully appointed, combining effortless style with cutting edge design. The Neff appliances are integrated and provide four ovens, including a steam oven, fridge freezer, dishwasher and Bean to Cup coffee machine. The central island unit has a highly polished Silestone work surface with a range of storage units incorporating the latest German Blu Motion soft close system, flush ceramic hob featuring quick-light cooking zones and pre-defined cooking areas and under-mount stainless steel sink with recessed drainage. Pop-up sockets with usb connection and remote control colour changing LED lighting are additional features, as is the recessed Luxair Italian extractor hood, also remote controlled.With independent access to and from both the front and rear of the property, the substantial utility has a vast array of storage options including additional fridge/freezer space and washing and drying appliances. There is integrated access to the garage, a cloakroom with WC and hand basin, and separate boiler room. In addition on the ground floor is a fully tiled wet room with black mirror stainless steel shower panel, body jets and hand set. Staircase access leads to the lower ground floor where you will find a fitted cinema room/snug with storage and also a rather useful wine/drinks store complete with refrigeration and work surfaces.The first and second floors are light and spacious, centred off the main stair-well and open, first floor landing. On this floor are five double bedrooms and two bathrooms, with an en-suite shower room and separate dressing room off bedroom one. A self-contained bedroom suite is situated on the second floor with a pretty master bedroom, golden oak and mirrored dressing room and stunning bathroom with separate shower, connected by the galleried landing. Natural light pours in from the perfectly situated sun tubes and excellent eaves storage is provided on both floors.Each bathroom is beautifully appointed, with LED backlit mirrors and white porcelain suites. The baths are freestanding and of contemporary design whilst the showers have Hudson Reed Shimmer Thermostatic Shower panels and chrome body jets. Each upstairs bathroom has an integrated wall mounted television screen with full audio, and each room in the house has integrated multimedia points.Outside the property is completely enclosed and private with access to the grey block paved driveway through bespoke powder coated steel gates, operated by double remote control and mobile phone technology. The gardens are mainly laid to lawn with pretty shrubs and borders and a variety of very well established trees. There is substantial parking for several vehicles however the electronic multi fold garage doors give access to a triple garage with underfloor heating, unglazed porcelain floor tiles with an anti-slip surface and plenty of secure storage. The outside of the building is half clad with Western Red Cedar and has grey, A energy rated PVCu glazing  short, this property is stunning. It provides flexible, spacious accommodation with the potential of five or six double bedrooms and matching living areas. There are few properties currently on the market offering the space, finish and location to match this house and we would advise viewing to avoid disappointment.Entrance Hallway - 9' 2'' x 15' 9'' (2.8m x 4.8m)Kitchen/Dining Room - 29' 3'' x 11' 10'' (8.912m x 3.609m)Sitting Room (l-Shaped) - 27' 6'' x 11' 11'' (8.386m x 3.638m)Cinema Room - 14' 6'' x 11' 6'' (4.418m x 3.502m)Bar/Wine Store - 6' 4'' x 6' 0'' (1.927m x 1.827m)Ground Floor Shower Room - 9' 10'' x 11' 10'' (3m x 3.6m)Utility Room - 15' 7'' x 9' 1'' (4.749m x 2.776m)Boiler RoomCloak RoomBedroom 1 - 18' 0'' x 12' 0'' (5.477m x 3.645m)Dressing Room - 5' 2'' x 9' 6'' (1.580m x 2.905m)Bedroom 2 - 16' 10'' x 11' 10'' (5.140m x 3.608m)Bedroom 3 - 12' 10'' x 11' 10'' (3.909m x 3.619m)Bedroom 4 - 11' 11'' x 11' 7'' (3.627m x 3.526m)En Suite Shower Room - 9' 5'' x 6' 3'' (2.880m x 1.902m)Bathroom - 13' 5'' x 9' 10'' (4.095m x 2.989m)Bedroon 5 - 17' 7'' x 16' 0'' (5.371m x 4.880m)Master Bedroom - 13' 5'' x 11' 6'' (4.080m x 3.508m)Dressing Room - 15' 11'' x 6' 3'' (4.863m x 1.898m)Bathroom - 12' 3'' x 11' 8'' (3.727m x 3.558m)

listing.letting_fees:
When renting a property with Currell, please be aware that fees will apply during the process. Details of these fees are as follows:

Administration Fees (Non-optional)
We charge £240 (including VAT) to cover the cost of administration of the tenancy. For clarity, this is a charge per tenancy and not per applicant.

Referencing Fees (Non-optional)
We use an independent referencing agency (rmt - Reference-My-Tenant) to carry out reference checks on all tenants. The cost of these checks are £40 (including VAT) per individual joining the tenancy and £50 (including VAT) if a company is being referenced. For clarity, each individual named in the tenancy agreement will need to pay a referencing fee. For example, 3 tenants = 3 referencing fees.

Check-In Fees (Non optional in the event that the Landlord uses the services of an Independent Inventory Clerk)
We use an independent inventory company (normally Ready Report) to carry out a Check-In and Check-Out service on all properties (subject to the landlord confirming that they wish to use this service). The cost of a check-in and check-out are identical and can vary from £108 (including VAT) to £240 (including VAT) dependent on the size of property and the amount of furnishings in the property. Most normally, tenants pay for a check-in and landlords pay for the check-out. For clarity, check in fees are payable per tenancy, not per applicant.

Early Termination (Non-optional in the event of leaving earlier than the tenancy allows)

A fundamental responsibility as a tenant is to pay your rent, but we recognize there may be circumstances whereby you need to break out of your tenancy early. If your Landlord agrees that the property can be re advertised, in order to find a suitable replacement tenant to take over your liability, you still need to continue making your regular rent payments until a new tenant takes occupation. In addition you will need to cover the Landlords fees for the unexpired term of your tenancy. These fees are calculated on a pro rata basis. Should you be thinking of leaving earlier than your tenancy agreement permits, you should contact your local branch as soon as possible for a detailed breakdown of the costs involved.

Other Fees

Currell also works on behalf of institutional, rather than private, Landlords who may have their own administration procedures and fees. This can mean that the costs vary from those detailed above. Details of these fees are available upon request, but please be assured that if these landlords charge fees then you will not be liable to pay any fees to us.

listing.description: The Garden Maisonette occupies the 2 lower floors of a handsome Grade I listed Georgian townhouse on the southerly side of this imposing street. The property has been sympathetically refurbished and designed by a well-respected local architect and offers a perfect blend of period and quality contemporary finishes, with spacious flexible accommodation.The property is accessed via a pretty courtyard to the front and entered into an impressive galleried hallway with a contemporary glass and steel balustrade which overlooks the drawing room. To the rear there is a pretty double bedroom with an attractive bay window and wall to wall, floor to ceiling built in wardrobes. The master bedroom which also has a beautifully appointed en-suite bath and shower room. In addition there is a further bath and shower room.A glass, steel and natural stone staircase leads down to the lower hallway from which all rooms lead. To the front with an attractive galleried aspect to the hallway is a large formal drawing room with contemporary recessed fireplace, along with a generous dining area. Double doors lead though to the well-equipped cooks kitchen which has a comprehensive range of bespoke units and a wealth of integrated appliances. In addition conveniently there is a large utility cupboard. Door leads through to a pretty garden room which leads on to the sun terraces. To the rear there is a further double bedroom which has lovely wall to wall glazed doors leading to the garden. In addition there is a guest cloakroom and plenty of cloaks storage.Externally accessed from both bedroom 3 and the garden room there is a charming south facing secluded walled garden with a wealth of mature shrubs and trees and attractive borders.SituationGreat Pulteney Street is a world class residential address in the heart of Georgian Bath and is conveniently located within easy level walking distance of the city centre. This impressive wide boulevard of 74 Grade I listed Georgian townhouses is flanked majestically by The Holburne Museum at the easterly aspect and Laura Place and Pulteney Bridge to the West. The unesco World Heritage City of Bath offers a wonderful array of chain and independent shopping outlets, many fine restaurants cafes and wine bars and a number of well-respected cultural activities which include a world famous international music and literary festival, many pre-London shows at The Theatre Royal, The Roman Baths and Pump Rooms, along with The One Royal Crescent and Holburne Museums.Many excellent state and independent schools are also within easy reach which include the nearby award winning St Mary’s Bathwick and Widcombe Primary Schools along with King Edwards Schools on North Road.World Class sporting facilities are available at nearby Bath Rugby and Cricket Clubs and at Bath University.Communications include a direct line to London Paddington (Cross Rail Link commences August 2017), Bristol and South Wales from Bath Spa Railway Station. The M4 Motorway is approximately 8 miles to the north and Bristol Airport is 18 miles to the west.Key FeaturesFirst class residential address3 bedrooms2 beautiful bathroomsWonderful blend of contemporary and period featuresArchitect designed accommodationStunning cooks kitchenLovely open plan galleried sitting and dining room

listing.description: This lovely four/five bedroom semi-detached home has been extended to provide fantastic living spaces for the growing family. Located in a residential road the house offers a most convenient and quiet location yet is ideally placed for multiple shopping and transport facilities, including Metropolitan Line stations and numerous bus routes. Nearby Nower Hill High School and Pinner Park School are both highly regarded schools. Accessed via a welcoming entrance hallway, the open plan sitting room and dining room allow versatile use for relaxing and dining and a separate front aspect room would be ideal as a study or a bedroom. The breakfast room is complemented by neutral tones and tiled flooring links it to the contemporary kitchen which features a range of modern wall and base units, solid worktops, stainless steel appliances and appointments. The detached outbuilding is currently used as a gym. To the front a driveway provides off street parking for multiple cars. EPC Rating D.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: A well presented detached family home offering spacious and versatile accommodation of about 2829 sq ft, situated in a prestigious and private close, within easy reach of Warlingham Green.   The accommodation on the ground floor comprises of a spacious reception hall, sitting room with feature brick fireplace and sliding doors opening on to the garden, separate dining room, study, cloakroom and bedroom with ensuite shower room. The kitchen/breakfast room is a particular feature of the property. It is a generous size with a feature brick wall, sliding doors giving access to the side and sky light allowing for maximum light penetration. There are a good range of wall and base wooden fronted cabinets and granite works tops. Integrated appliances include a Stoves oven with 7 ring gas hob and extractor, fridge/freezer and dishwasher. A double garage can be accessed from the separate utility room that has plumbing for additional appliances. The upstairs accommodation is also of good proportions and include a master bedroom suite with fitted wardrobes and ensuite bathroom, three further bedrooms a family bathroom and galleried landing.SituationHuntsmans Close is a private and prestigious development off Homefield Road within easy reach of Warlingham Green with its range of local shops, restaurants and pubs and Sainsburys supermarket is a short distance away. The beautiful North Downs are close at hand providing the opportunity for pleasant walks. Nearby Upper Warlingham railway station (in zone 6) provides services to London Bridge and Victoria in approximately 35 minutes. The M25 motorway is about 4 miles away at junction 6. There are schools in both the state and private sectors, golf courses and riding schools nearby.OutsideTo the front of the property there is driveway providing off-street parking which leads to a double garage. The garage usefully has direct internal access to the house. The front garden is laid to lawn with flower beds and hedgerow. The rear garden enjoys a high degree of seclusion and is enclosed by evergreen trees, hedgerow and timber fencing. It is a wide level garden with a patio, lawn and mature flower borders.Entrance Hall Cloakroom Kitchen Dining Room Utility Room Sitting Room Dining Room Study Master Bedroom Bathroom Ensuite Shower Room Garage
listing.short_description: A well presented detached family home offering spacious and versatile accommodation of about 2788 sqft, situated in a prestigious and private close, within easy reach of Warlingham Green.

listing.description: Summary  Occupying a prime location in this busy Cotswolds town, a freehold retail/residential investment offering tremendous development potential.The ground floor retail unit extends to approximately 1400 sq ft and comprises of a large shop with extensive storage providing an opportunity to extend the existing retail space if required.To the first and second floor is a good quality duplex apartment comprising; living room, dining room/bedroom three, study area, bedroom, bathroom & shower room and a kitchen/breakfast room.To the second floor is a further bedroom and dressing room.Outside the apartment enjoys lovely private gardens and benefits from off road parking accessed via an electric gate off Church Lane.Location  Burford is traditionally known as the 'Gateway to the Cotswolds' An area of outstanding natural beauty protected by the Cotswold Conservation Board. Burford itself has a broad main high street lined with old houses cottages and shops which appear not to have changed for hundreds of years. The town is situated just off the A40,19 miles from Oxford, 29 miles from Gloucester and 75 miles from London.The town offers good facilities including a comprehensive school, primary school, medical surgery, library, numerous public houses and a variety of shops.Planning  Planning was granted on the 7th June 2012 (12/0890/P/fp)"Erection of dwelling and detached carport with studio/storage above, internal alterations to flat and storage area to shop"

listing.description: Greenhill is a 1920’s detached family home having undergone significant extension and improvement offering versatile and well planned living accommodation yet still retaining much of the original charm and character. Overall there is in excess of 3000 sq. Ft. Of accommodation which comprises entrance hall with natural wood flooring, exposed beams and natural elm staircase and undoubtedly one of the features of the property is the 30ft x 17ft kitchen/dining room with a Mark Wilkinson fitted kitchen area with a range of fitted and free standing appliances, granite work surfaces and oak breakfast bar, all complemented by natural stone flooring. From the kitchen there is a fantastic view of the garden through the full width bi folding doors. The dual aspect living room also benefits from bi folding doors, feature fireplace and oak flooring and three further reception rooms, a utility room and cloakroom round off the ground floor accommodation. To the first there are five double bedrooms with the master bedroom being to the rear with dual aspect windows, large walk in dressing room and en suite. The front aspect guest bedroom also has an en suite shower and there is a luxury family bathroom. The property also benefits from radiator central heating and double glazed windows throughout and is offered with no onward chain complications.LocationThe property is conveniently located for the commuter with the M3 and M4 motorways easily accessible and trains from Crowthorne station to Reading, Guildford and beyond. Local shops serve everyday needs well and more comprehensive facilities are available nearby at Camberley, The Meadows and Wokingham. Schooling is well served both by state and public schools most notable amongst them Wellington College, Eagle House and Yateley Manor. The property is also close to East Berkshire Golf Club and further leisure facilities can be found at Wellington College.OutsideThe property is approached to the front via a five bar gate with extensive off road parking which leads to the adjoining single garage. To the rear of the property there is a raised timber decking area providing extensive outside seating and dining space with steps down to the formal garden which is laid mainly to lawn with established flower and shrub borders and enclosed by mature hedging. At the rear of the formal garden is a further open plan area ideal for young children with a timber fort and large area for trampoline, football, swings and slide etc.SituationA beautiful five bedroom 1920’s detached family home with four reception rooms and a good sized garden on the outskirts of this sought after Berkshire village.

listing.description: Set upon an extremely well maintained plot (two acres approx), with open field views to front and rear, we are delighted to offer for sale this stunning property, an imposing Four Bedroom, 5 bathroom detached residence within this sought after village with excellent road and rail links.Greenwood Place is a property offering huge amounts of space and very well presented living spread across two floors with extensive grounds offered externally. This fantastic family home offers well proportioned living.The ground floor offering two large reception rooms, stunning oak kitchen/diner, office and ground floor shower room and WC. listing.description: A characterful, well-kept five bedroom detached house, built in 1936 in the style of a Dutch cottage. Unique in design with a tiled 'Gambrel' roof, with low sloping eaves, the property has many of the original features in keeping with the period, whilst having been sympathetically modernised and extended by the present owners. The fabulous hallway is finished in oak panelling with a solid oak 'open tread' staircase to the first floor. A second identical staircase continues from the landing to the top floor, which comprises two bright, sizable double bedrooms. On the ground floor, there are two generous reception rooms, a guest toilet and a fitted kitchen. The main reception room has a lovely integrated double glazed conservatory extension, with views over the garden. On the first floor are three double bedrooms, the main one with fitted furniture, and a large family bathroom. The garden is stocked with assorted flowers and shrubs surrounding a well-tended lawn, enclosed by timber fencing. There is a garage with its own driveway to the side. A very pleasant location on a quiet road, only a short walk from the delightful Friary Park and North Middlesex Golf Course, with good transport connections, popular local schools and an array of shops, eateries and restaurants available on North Finchley High Road.

listing.description: An exceptionally well presented four double bedroom contemporary house having been extensively upgraded by its current owners. The property boasts spacious accommodation arranged over three floors benefiting from open plan living with private south facing terrace, en-suite to master bedroom and bedroom two. Large garage with utility at rear. Lilliput and Baden Powell School Catchment.The AreaNo 2 Point South is located in the heart of Lilliput in one of the area's premier roads, and within a short level walk to local shops.Close by is the renowned Salterns Marina offering superb boating facilities and the Blue Flag beaches of Sandbanks. At the end of Sandbanks Peninsula is the chain link ferry giving vehicular and pedestrian access to the many miles of National Heritage coastline of the Isle of Purbeck.Lilliput is ideally located for those needing travel connections to London, the rest of Europe and beyond. London Waterloo can be reached in under two hours via train and road and Bournemouth International Airport offers both internal and international flights to a variety of destinations.The PropertyPoint South is a stunning development of three houses which nestle into the landscape of this popular residential area, which enjoys a rich and diverse array of amenities. No.2 is an ideal house for those wishing to enjoy substantial accommodation, whether as a family, or for oneself. The immediate proximity of the local golf course, marinas, beaches and salubrious village locations makes this an ideal home, whether as a main property or a 'lock up and leave' easy to maintain second residence.The spacious accommodation is arranged over three floors and comprises four double bedrooms, of which two are en suite. A further family bathroom serves the remaining bedrooms and there is a conveniently placed ground floor shower room on the entrance level. The principal accommodation is mainly open plan and opens onto a level and well maintained rear garden, which is a good size and offers a secure area for children and dogs. listing.description: Handsome detached 3/4 bedroom farmhouse with three substantial outbuildings set in 17.25 acres in a wonderful rural location with far reaching views.The farm is all about position. The property sits in an elevated site nestled in some outstanding rolling countryside in a peaceful rural location yet within two miles of Bridport town. The house itself is a classic doubled fronted farmhouse which has the potential, as it is not listed, to be substantially extended or remodelled to take in the outhouse/cottage behind. At present the house has three bedrooms and a shower room upstairs and downstairs a sitting room, a dining room, a kitchen and a fourth bedroom served by a family bathroom. Across from the farmhouse there is a substantial stone and block Barn while on the west side there is a large four bay agricultural barn. On three sides of the house the land stretches out from the property and is laid to pasture enclosed by post & wire fencing and hedge from which far-reaching views can be enjoyed.

listing.description: English country house with californian vibe A meticulously refurbished country house combining an elegant blend of contemporary and traditional styles. Positioned on the edge of the village, the house sits wonderfully in its plot of approx. 0.75 acres with views from its south facing balcony over the surrounding countryside. Situated less than 10 mins from Market Harborough train station with a direct rail service to London St. Pancras from 55 mins EPC rating: CMain houseA rare example of having perfectly combined a traditional, stone country house with the latest advancements in technology with exquisite detail given over to the internal specification. The house is accessed via bespoke, electric wooden gates onto an extensive driveway with parking for multiple vehicles. The accommodation begins with the kitchen / breakfast room being accessed via the inner hallway and boasting hand crafted oak kitchen, bespoke 'double depth' work tops, two 'Miele' ovens - electric and steam and induction hob. There is a video entry system for the main gates and the tiled floor, like all those throughout the house, benefits from under floor heating. Doors open onto the south facing terrace and the office is accessed via the living area of the kitchen. The accommodation flows on from the internal office space into the stunning 27 ft lounge room / music studio with south facing bay window, Brazilian walnut flooring and multi-fuel burner. The flooring continues with steps rising to the mezzanine sitting area, currently displaying a grand piano, and on to the magnificent drawing room, with views over the landscaped rear garden. Further stairs rise into the vaulted ceiling to another mezzanine housing a study and sitting area. Ground floor accommodation is completed by a bespoke laundry room housing floor to ceiling storage units, 'Corian' work tops and built in sink. This room contains the CCTV system and adjacent to it is a separate cloakroom. The Brazilian walnut flooring continues on the first floor where all of the bedrooms radiate from the bright first floor landing and the family bathroom has 'Porcelanosa' tiling whilst the master bedroom with ensuite is of particular note with its south facing balcony and views over the stunning gardens and countryside beyond. Both bathrooms contain fitments for integrated waterproof televisions.Annexe and swim spaTo the ground floor, the independent annexe boasts an air-conditioned swim spa / gym with a 'dimension 1' swim spa and Jacuzzi as well as a newly fitted 'kitchenette' and an integrated cinema system with projector and amplifier. The glazed doors retract to allow access to the gardens in the summer and the room benefits from under floor heating for the winter months.There is a fully fitted annexe bedroom above from which the landscaped gardens can be admired whilst the ensuite shower room has a 'pebble' tiled floor and 'Porcelanosa' fitments.Gardens and groundsThe rear gardens are of particular note being a wonderfully mature, private space with various zones for entertaining and for different times of the day. There are two main terraces, both facing south, accessed via the main house and the annexe respectively. A decked area includes a semi-permanent marquee looking up the gardens whilst the stunning fire pit, with seating all around, looks back toward the house. The rest of the gardens are mainly laid to lawn and are bordered by stone walls, bamboo and 'Iroko' bespoke fencing and laurel hedgerow. They gently slope up from the house and lead to a large summer house on the eastern boundary. They also contain a 'rain harvesting' system which collects water from the roofs and is connected to a customised sprinkler system that has been professionally designed to provide water throughout the extensive outdoor space.SituationCommunication links are excellent with the A14 approx. Five miles to the south giving access to the M1 and M6 to the west, in turn providing access to Birmingham International, Coventry and East Midlands Airports. Mainline train services are available from Market Harborough to London St Pancras from 55 minutes.SchoolingThere is a wide selection of state and independent schooling in the area including preparatory schools at Spratton Hall, Maidwell Hall and Stoneygate (Great Glen). Secondary schooling is at Rugby, Oakham, Oundle, Wellingborough, Guilsborough and Uppingham whilst both primary and secondary schooling is at Pitsford (Northampton) and Leicester Grammar School (Great Glen).General informationServices: Mains water and electricity connected. Mains drainage system and oil-fired central heating system for house and annexe.Local Authority: Kettering District CouncilCouncil Tax Band: Gepc rating: C

listing.description: No 7 Mackay HouseThree-bedroom house over three levels with study, terrace and balconyWhite Lion PlaceLocated on Portsmouth Road, in the heart of Cobham, White Lion Place is an exclusive collection of 30 newly-built and converted houses, apartments and duplexes, designed with retirement in mind.The six converted properties are the result of Beechcroft’s careful conversion of a Grade II listed building that played a major role in Cobham’s history. The former White Lion was the first stop on the stagecoach route from London to Portsmouth and, whilst the elevations are mainly 18th century, parts of this historic building date back to the 16th century.The 24 newly built homes, set in three buildings – Barley House, Mackay House and The Malthouse include a collection of two, three and four-bedroom apartments and duplexes along with a three-bedroom house. Each unique new home provides plenty of generously-proportioned living space and all have outside space in the form of private gardens, terraces, balconies, Juliette balconies or roof terraces. All the stylish, energy-efficient homes at White Lion Place have been designed to reflect the grandeur of the listed building and historical relevance of the site and each features the contemporary, high quality specification that is a hallmark of all Beechcroft properties.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
