listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.

listing.description: St George Wharf is a landmark riverside development spanning across 7 acres of London's hottest area of regeneration, and conveniently, just moments from London's Vauxhall Underground Station. Initially rising 22 storeys but now with the addition of the 48 storey Tower, the tallest sole residential building in the UK, St George Wharf is a focal point of the South Bank. The main development is easily identifiable by its gull-wing roofs and stylish terraces; Broadway Malyan Architects had a willingness to champion innovation and as such have designed an original and expressive building with a fantastic attention to detail. Riverside living does not get much better than this.Residents of this SW8 development, St George Wharf, often comment on its sense of community, with a stunning series of landscaped courtyards and elegant fountains creating an idyllic rural atmosphere in the heart of central London. St George Wharf combines this serene courtyard with state of the art facilities; amenities include a supermarket, restaurant and bar, an nhs Doctors, dentist, a 24hr gymnasium and a spa offering a wide variety of treatments.In keeping with the green ethos of the development, the newly completed Tower will require one third of the energy currently used by similar buildings. Specifically, One, The Tower will house a wind turbine to power common lighting areas and a London Aquifer (complete with heat pump technology) to extract warmth from water to heat apartments during the winter. Triple-glazed windows throughout minimise heat loss in winter whilst ventilated blinds between the glazing protects apartments from heat through direct sunlight.Not only is St George Wharf a peaceful environment in the heart of the capital, it's also a safe one. With apartments accessible to a 24 hour concierge service, CCTV and a video entry system into each property, safety and security in the development was paramount in the developer's approach.Apartments vary from studios to luxury 5 bedroom penthouses, all finished to the highest specification. The breath-taking river views and fantastic transport links ensure St George Wharf is the best of both worlds in terms of luxury and necessity. With Vauxhall Underground Station right on your doorstep Victoria, Green Park and Oxford Circus stations are all just minutes away. The nearby Vauxhall Rail Station means areas such as Waterloo and Clapham Junction are also easily accessible.
listing.short_description: Montgomery & Slate are proud to present this stunning studio apartment in The Tower, St George Wharf situated in the sought after Vauxhall SW8. This stunning development is beside the Vauxhall bridge and MI6's headquarter.

listing.letting_fees:
If you choose to rent a property through Gibson Lane we will require the following:
Before the start of the tenancy a deposit equivalent to six weeks rent (calculated by dividing the annual rent by 52 and multiplying by 6), in addition to the first months rent and the tenancy agreement fee must be paid. This is subject to contract and referencing, a landlord may require a higher deposit, rent in advance or a guarantor if the referencing criteria is not met or if you have pets, further details will be provided at that time.

Application Fee:

£500 per Tenancy.

The application fee is deducted from the final amount you pay when you move in.

Reference and Administration Fee:

£100 + VAT (£120.00) per applicant.

All applicants named on the tenancy agreement must be referenced.

Should your income (combined income for joint tenants) not meet 2.5 x the annual rent you will be required to provide a guarantor or pay rent in advance for the full term of the tenancy. Guarantors are required to complete the referencing process and must have an income of 2.5 x the annual rent.

Guarantor Reference and Administration Fee:

£100 + VAT (£120.00) per guarantor.

You should be aware that the need for a Guarantor may not become apparent until your referencing, (including for any joint tenants) has been completed, therefore guarantor referencing fee(s) will only become payable should a guarantor be required.

Tenancy Agreement Fee:

£150 + VAT (£180.00)

One off charge for the Tenancy Agreement preparation.

Renewal/Extension agreements:

£100 + VAT (£120.00)

One off charge for each renewal/extension.

Inventory Fees:

Inventory Check In/Out fees as per the Tenancy Agreement. In most circumstances the Landlord will cover the costs of the inventory and check in and the tenant will pay for the check out. The check out fee is usually deducted from the tenants deposit at the end of the tenancy. These fees are variable depending on the size of the property and the duration of the Tenancy and starts from £160 + VAT. Please feel free to contact this office for a price on a particular property or for more information on any charges.

Please note:

If you withdraw from the proposed tenancy for any reason we will retain your application fee and any additional fees you have paid.

listing.description: The PropertyIs located within the Village of Hartlip and overlooking the the downs, which is regarded an area of outstanding natural beauty. The property was built in the 1930's and the accommodation comprises of Farmhouse Style Kitchen/Breakfast Room, Utility Room, two Conservatory's have been added, one is off the Kitchen and the other is off both the Reception rooms, In addition there is a study and a downstairs Cloakroom. To the first floor there are five bedrooms in total, the master coming with an attractive En-Suite shower room and there is also a family Bathroom complete with a Victorian style free standing bath and matching pedestal sink and low level WC. From the first floor landing there are stairs leading up to the second floor where you will find a good size sixth Bedroom which is an ideal teenagers/hobby room.The GroundsYou enter the grounds via an electronic gate and will follow a long driveway arriving at a gravel driveway. As impressive as the property is, the grounds it sits in are the real jewel in the crown with over 3.5 acres at your disposal. The current owners have previously used the property as a smallholding for a range of animals including Horses, Sheep, Chickens, Dogs and even cattle. The outbuildings are all there to accommodate such with a four bay Stable block, Barn, Sheep Pen, and a range of sheds to accommodate all the necessary storage needs. There also two double garage blocks which can easily house more than than just the families vehicles. For those that are interested in other leisure activities then once again, this will not disappoint. For tennis enthusiasts there is a fully fenced tennis court, and for those who enjoy a swim, they will find an enclosed swimming pool and once done you can take advantage and relax within the hot tub. If after that you still have the energy for something else then take advantage of the outside games rooms providing enough space for table tennis or a pool table.

listing.description: Entrance  A door accesses a spacious hallway providing a warm welcoming to this substantial family home.Breakfast Kitchen  Currently situated to the rear of the property, however, there is plenty of scope to re-position a large open plan dining kitchen into another area of this superior sized home, creating a large utility or garden room where the kitchen currently is. Patio doors access a sizeable rear patio.Formal Dining Room  A large formal dining area, having through light courtesy of a double glazed window to both front and rear. A stone fireplace houses a multi fuel stove and a characterful beamed ceiling provides plenty of charm. Again, this room creating versatile uses could be a play room or second sitting room.Sitting Room  A grand sized sitting room providing a wonderful feel of 'hub of the home' boasting beamed ceilings with exposed stone fire, housing a log burning stove. Two sets of French doors connect both to the front and rear garden as well as providing an abundance of natural light. A wide, open plan, sweeping staircase leads up to the first floor rooms, in addition giving eye-catching characterful period features of the high landing beamed ceiling together with fabulous exposed stone walling.Drawing Room  As our measurements suggest, this is another generous sized room with versatile uses creating opportunity for a games room or an open plan breakfast kitchen. Stairs led down to the annexe.Annexe  Originally used as a games room, however the entire lower ground floor could be completely separated from the house, creating an annexe for an elderly relative. The beautiful character continues, having delightful beamed ceilings, three sets of patio doors accessing the front, side and rear of the property, along with a separated room for a bedroom and a cloakroom which could be converted into a WC. Again, if an annexe was not required, this could be a spacious dining kitchen.Master Bedroom  Boasting a sizeable master bedroom, having characterful sloping ceilings with an abundance of fitted furniture, separate dressing room and a modern en-suite shower room. This fabulous bedroom has double glazed windows to all three sides, which frames stunning far reaching views.Further Bedrooms and Bathroom  Having a further four bedrooms and a study, one of which boasts a modern fitted en-suite. All the bedrooms have characterful features and stunning views. Along with a contemporary fitted bathroom suite, comprising of a deep sunken bath, corner jet spa shower, wash basin with vanity unit below and WC.Outside  Sat within 6 acres, having gardens to all sides and with large patios, providing excellent space for Summer get-togethers. This is the perfect home if you want to surrounded yourself with stunning scenery, along with giving land for those with equestrian interest.

listing.description: This breathtaking one bedroom apartment on the third floor of this new development which is due for completion in Q4 2016 offers 570sq ft of accommodation including open plan living / kitchen / dining area, master bedroom with fitted wardrobes, bathroom, together with a separate utility cupboard and stunning north facing winter garden.Famous for being the seat of the country's government, Westminster has always been a highly desired postcode. People have thrived here over the years and today is no different. Only a few minutes' walk away are the Houses of Parliament, Big Ben, Westminster Bridge and the imposing Westminster Abbey. Steeped in more than a thousand years of history, this striking church is still one of the most important Gothic buildings in the country. Nearby Parliament Square and Whitehall have both witnessed many a meaningful decision on the ruling of the nation over the years. Westminster Quarter has many esteemed neighbours: Buckingham Palace, Horse Guards Parade, Trafalgar Square, The National Gallery and Tate Britain to name but a few.The development will comprise of 91 luxury apartments, many with private outdoor space. Residents will also benefit from an exclusive gym, 24hr concierge service, landscaped courtyard and a landscaped residents roof terrace and roof lounge which will afford unrivalled views of the Houses Parliament and other iconic landmarks Stylish interiors designed to the highest specification invite the resident to relax and feel instantly at home. From bespoke kitchens and luxury appliances, every detail has been regarded with respect. Many of the stunning apartments have the added bonus of winter gardens or balconies. Floor to ceiling windows flood the living areas with natural light and give the feeling of even more space. All this adds up to generous homes that are ideal for living and entertaining.

listing.description: Entrance hall 14' 4" x 14' 2" (4.38m x 4.32m) maxliving room 23' 8" x 14' 4" (7.23m x 4.37m) maxkitchen/dining/family room 36' 10" x 29' 4" (11.25m x 8.95m) maxutility room 12' 3" x 6' 8" (3.75m x 2.04m)wet room 6' 7" x 5' 5" (2.02m x 1.67m)WC first floor landing bedroom 1 20' 9" x 19' 2" (6.35m x 5.85m) maxensuite bedroom 2  15' 0" x 14' 10" (4.59m x 4.53m) maxbedroom 3  15' 5" x 14' 11" (4.72m x 4.57m) maxbedroom 4 11' 6" x 10' 7" (3.53m x 3.23m)bathroom 9' 10" x 9' 6" (3.02m x 2.92m)  Ivan House is a brand new, four double bedroomed detached property set in an enviable, rural location on the outskirts of the highly regarded village of Henham. The property benefits from a large, secluded plot with spectacular countryside views and modern, open plan living accommodation. Built with traditional timber frame methods combined with modern materials, the property maintains many period character features but with the convenience of modern technology and efficiencies. The village of Henham provides good amenities including the village jmi School which has an excellent reputation. There is also a public house, active local church and community groups. There is easy access to the larger village of Elsenham with a village store, public houses, schooling and railway station with direct links to London Liverpool Street and Cambridge. Stansted Airport with fast train services and the M11 (J8) is approximately 10 minutes by car. The market town of Bishops Stortford is 9 miles to the south  The open plan kitchen offers flexible living accommodation with the modern conveniences of a range cooker with 6 ring gas hob, wine cooler, American style fridge/freezer, built in microwave, dishwasher and double butler sink. This is further enhanced by Quartz work surfaces and soft close drawers and doors. Two sets of bi-fold doors offer stunning views of the garden and surround farmland.• Plot approx. 0.5 of an acre (sts)• Gas central heating• Westbury Joinery windows and doors• Under floor heating to the ground floor• Pre-wired for HD TV distribution• Pre-wired for multi room audio• Detached double garage with remote electric up and over doors• Large outdoor entertaining terrace• Mains pressure hot water system• 5 Volt ring main in the living Room• Mutli fuel stove in the living Room• pura bathroom ceramics and brassware throughout• Triple aspect living room• Triple aspect master bedroom• Feature brick inglenook fireplace
